title: The Invisible Container
weather: Winter darkness, cold, light snow by afternoon

Sara_Lindqvist.location: Limhamn Harbor, then driving back to city
Sara_Lindqvist.emotional_state: Professional determination mixed with underlying dread about being outmatched
knows: Ghost containers exist - 30 found at Limhamn
Adversarial ML attacks make containers invisible to port AI
Smugglers use fake IoT signatures to appear legitimate
The actual contraband was offloaded months ago - they're too late
Other algorithmic crimes are happening in Malmö (pharmacy robberies, burglaries)
The systems can be monitored by criminals in real-time
doesn't_know_yet: Who is behind the smuggling operation
How the pharmacy robberies work specifically
That multiple separate criminal operations are using similar techniques
skills_demonstrated: Asking the right questions despite limited technical knowledge
Sara_Lindqvist.personal_stakes_established: Her father's job loss to automation creates personal connection to the case

Emil_Bergström.location: Limhamn Harbor with Sara, then presumably returning to crime lab
Emil_Bergström.emotional_state: Professionally engaged but underlying cynicism showing - 'we're too late'
knows: How adversarial ML attacks work technically
The smugglers can monitor port systems in real-time
Pattern of other algorithmic crimes in Malmö
Police are structurally behind criminals in technical sophistication
doesn't_know_yet: Full scope of the algorithmic crime ecosystem
That he'll eventually identify Yusuf's signature
skills_demonstrated: Pattern recognition across different crime types

Petri.emotional_state: Unsettled by the breakdown of familiar systems, proud of catching the anomaly
knows: Port operations and normal container workflows
How to spot anomalies through manual observation
The automated systems can be fooled
Petri.role: Supporting character - represents old guard dockworkers being displaced

revealed_to_reader: Adversarial ML attacks on automated port systems are possible
Malmö's port is compromised by sophisticated smugglers
Sara's personal connection to automation displacement (father's story)
Emil's growing cynicism about police keeping up with tech crime
There are multiple algorithmic crimes happening in Malmö
The theme: invisibility through looking normal to algorithms

planted.element: Chen Wei as background port worker
planted.planted_how: Not directly introduced yet, but port workers mentioned
planted.significance: She's the inside connection to smuggling operation

planted.planted_how: His comments about being 'too late' and criminals staying ahead
planted.significance: Will reach crisis point at midpoint

planted.planted_how: Emil's text at end about pharmacy robberies and burglaries
planted.significance: Pattern recognition that this is an ecosystem, not isolated

planted.planted_how: Sara sees it in distance, wonders about ghosts in that machine
planted.significance: Will be location of apartment burglaries investigation

planted.planted_how: Backstory about Erik Lindqvist losing job to automation
planted.significance: Personal stakes in understanding algorithmic displacement

planted.planted_how: Realization that criminals can monitor port cameras
planted.significance: Setup for revelation that all surveillance infrastructure is exploitable

active_tensions: Police are reactive, criminals are proactive - always behind
Traditional detective work vs technical expertise gap
Sara's competence vs her awareness of being outmatched by systems
Human obsolescence - dockworkers, Sara's father, eventually Sara herself?
world_changes: Limhamn Harbor's security protocols will need review
Customs and Europol now involved in smuggling investigation
Port operations center is aware their AI systems were compromised
technical_concepts_introduced: Automated logistics systems and AI container management

locations_established.Limhamn_Harbor: Automated port with cranes, container yards, operations center. Mix of old infrastructure and new AI systems.
locations_established.Geography: Malmö, Sweden. Winter setting. Connection to Öresund strait. E20 highway. Turning Torso visible from port.

evidence_collected: GPS movement logs showing unauthorized transfers
Forensic data from phones - ML models, sensor simulation code
Container registration numbers and movement history
leads: One container went dark when they approached - criminals monitoring in real time
Connection to other algorithmic crimes in Malmö
Europol interest suggests international smuggling network
dead_ends: Criminals have superior technical capability and awareness
next_steps: Full forensic analysis of phones and ML models
Cross-reference with other algorithmic crime cases
Interview port personnel (including Chen Wei, though they don't know her yet)

themes_developed.invisibility_through_pattern: Ghost containers are invisible by looking normal to AI
themes_developed.data_exhaust_as_weapon: Port's own logs and sensors were exploited
themes_developed.human_obsolescence: Petri and Sara's father both being displaced by automation

tone_notes: Clinical, procedural, cold. Nordic noir atmosphere. Technical concepts explained clearly. Sense of being outmatched but not giving up. Dry humor in Sara and Emil's exchanges. No melodrama - just the creeping realization of how big this is.
